Worked perfectly for me! Thank you!

So once you mount the disk image you will find a ReadME with Russian at the top and a list of about 45 hosts below. Open your /etc/hosts file with a text editor and add the listed hosts to the file. It will prevent the app from communicating with the authentication servers. Do this and change the framework folder, and everything should be working. Older versions of this software family found on this site provide more thorough documentation of the host blocking process. Cheers.

Right-click on Illustrator.app files in your Applications folder / select Show Package Contents / Look for the Frameworks folder and open it.

Still getting "Tryout" after installing it (like Photoshop CS6). I'm gonna keep trying and report back with any good luck...

This really does work. Followed everything on the English Readme, but used the crack on the Illustrator CS6.dmg. Opened and closed all apps, selecting tryout for Illustrator. Replaced framework on all applications, mind you Wi-Fi was off this entire time. Opened Illustrator and it worked just fine, didn't prompt for serial numbers.

Even though you get the Tryout splash & about screens, it's still cracked to the full version. For all of those who want to get rid of that Tryout crap just do this:

1) Right-click on the Adobe Illustrator CS6.app
2) Click Show Package Contents
3) Go to Contents/Resources
4) Switch the names of ai_about_tryout.png to ai_about.png. Do the same for ai_cs6_splash_tryout.png & ai_cs6_splash.png

Thank you! It works great.

Worked for me!

For anybody having trouble this is what I did step by step:

Download torrent. 
Turn off Wifi.
Go to Finder.

In Finder double click the blue folder you just downloaded (adobe illustrator cs6 16.0.0 final).

Now double click "illustrator CS6.dmg".

A new window will pop up, in this new window double click "illustrator_16_LS16.dmg).

A small window will pop up saying "opening illustrator_16_LS16.dmg".  Let it do its thing.

Once thats done, a new window will pop up and there will be a dark brown box that will have "Adobe Illustrator" written next to it. Double click this box.

Another window will open, double click the red "install" box.

Wait for the shit to load, then it will open a new window that says "welcome". This window will have 2 options: "install" and "try". Select "try".

Agree to the Terms.

Next Select "install". Make sure you have English selected as your language!

Let it install itself.

Once it's done installing go to your applications and open "Adobe Illustrator CS6". Once its finished opening Quit out of it.

Now open Finder.

Open the blue folder (adobe illustrator CS6 16.0.0 Final).
Now double click the blue folder labeled "cracked".
Double click "Adobe CS6 azr+.zip"
It will unzip and make a folder labeled "Adobe CS6 azr+ [k]. Double click it.
Inside there will be a folder labeled "amtlib.framework" (this is the cracked folder). Now you have to use this cracked "amtlib.framework" folder to replace the same folder located in my instructions below.

In Finder go to Applications
Right click on Adobe Illustrator CS6
Now click "show package contents"
Click the blue folder labeled "contents"
In the folder labeled "Frameworks" there is a folder labeled "amtlib.framework". Replace this folder with the cracked "amtlib.framework" folder i mentioned earlier. 
And that's what I did.

I didn't do any of the route blocking.

But if you go System Preferences/ Security & Privacy/ click the tab "firewall" and unlock the lock (located at the lower left of the window) to make changes. Then click "Firewall Options". Click the "+" symbol on the left. Now under applications tab select Adobe Illustrator CS6 and click Add.
Once illustrator is added, to the right of it there will be a small up and down arrow. click it. and Click "block incoming connections". 
That will keep illustrator from sending info out.

I did the same when i installed Photoshop CS6 and Lightroom 4. (which all work fine) 

Hope This Shit Helps!!!
